cons: not an option for remote work

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Sewanee, TN
pros: Talented students and colleagues in a beautiful if rural location. Salary and benefits are reasonable but do not compare well with peer and aspirant institutions
cons: Related to the above, salary and benefits are not highly competitive. Visiting assistant professors should request clarity from the dept. chair regarding retention. Administration is leaving several tenure-track positions unfilled across the University while it invests more in other aspects of the institution.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Sewanee, TN
pros: Faculty colleagues were generally good; technology staff were excellent.
cons: Job requires a Ph.D. but only pays $45000. There has been a hiring freeze on tenure track (may have been lifted at this point). At least a handful of the new visiting faculty did not access to their email and school resources; several us only made it to faculty orientation by word of mouth since all information was being sent to our faculty emails. I was specifically told mine wasn't ready a week into my contract but had emails dating back to three months before my contract once I finally had access. Students were made at me for not having textbooks in the school store but this was because I wasn't added to my courses until a week or two before the semester. The university has rental housing for faculty that is walking distance campus but this doesn't outweigh the fact that it's overpriced (in large part because the university has a monopoly on the housing in the area).

pros: Great benefits, paid time off, fun work environment

job_title: Group Fitness Instructor in Sewanee, TN
pros: Amazing boss, training provided, flexible team
cons: Low pay for fitness industry standards

job_title: Food Service Worker in Sewanee, TN
cons: Low pay for heavy amount of work.

pros: Welcoming, super nice, great people, lax environment

job_title: Access Services Assistant in Sewanee, TN
pros: Fairly open to communication, good humor in regards to TAS's duties, which cover many duties from my experience, always trying to keep things going in spite of the stress
cons: Potentially a flaw of the temp position, but moreso the immediate nature of assisting with various projects without an idea of an end goal. Communication was done well, though, and no real issues that weren't solved (because they're tech support and the problems were technical in nature)

pros: I love my boss and the people I work with.
wonderful people, good work life balance, competitive salary. Working with students was a nice experience. Great dining hall on campus!
cons: sometimes divide between locals and those brought in. not much interaction between faculty and staff.

job_title: Math/Computer Science Tutor in Sewanee, TN
pros: Good work environment, good people to work with, easy going dat
cons: Not a good location. If you like the city, do not come here

review_title: A great place to live and raise a family.
pros: The student athletes are easy to work with and coach.
cons: The University does not back athletics. Recruiting is difficult do to high academic standards and no help from Fin Aid or admissions.

job_title: Faculty Technology Specialist in Sewanee, TN
pros: Good environment,  great teamwork and beautiful campus.
cons: Workload was fast or famine.  My location was isolated.
